title: Address Unknown
description: First appearing in Story magazine in 1938, ADDRESS UNKNOWN became an immediate social phenomenon and literary sensation and was published in book form a year later. Banned in Nazi Germany, it garnered high praise in the United States and across Europe.ADDRESS UNKNOWN is a series of fictional letters between a Jewish art dealer living in San Francisco and his former business partner, who has returned to Germany in 1933. It remains a chilling, haunting tale of enduring impact.
author: Kathrine Kressmann Taylor
